intro: Chaenorhinum foroughii, commonly known as the Persian toothpick or foroughii toothpick, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces bright yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
